intro: Haworthia elizeae, commonly known as the Elize’s Haworthia, is a species of succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically fleshy and covered in a layer of white wax. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange, which appear on slender stems during the growing season. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for rock gardens or indoor cultivation. Its compact size and unique appearance make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
